intro: Euphrasia genargentea, commonly known as the silverweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Euphrasia genargentea is often found in nutrient-poor soils and is considered a good indicator plant for certain ecological conditions.
